remarks: Uniqueness of the foot point.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 1-Mar-2020.)
statement:
isperp.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
isperp.d $e |- .- = ( dist ` G ) $.
isperp.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
isperp.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
isperp.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
isperp.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. ran L ) $.
footeq.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. A ) $.
footeq.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. A ) $.
footeq.z $e |- ( ph -> Z e. P ) $.
footeq.1 $e |- ( ph -> ( X L Z ) ( perpG ` G ) A ) $.
footeq.2 $e |- ( ph -> ( Y L Z ) ( perpG ` G ) A ) $.
footeq $p |- ( ph -> X = Y ) $.
